content.description: The T is obvious from the highway.  Climb the crack, place some gear in the horizontal, then hope you don't fall before the summit.
content.protection: nuts, small/medium cams.  A #3 camolot might help. A one rope rappel from chains gets you down.
content.location: Picture Rock is the next formation south of Totem Pole  as you head toward the Cathedral Spires parking lot.

content.description: A forgotten route which climbs a tall S rib feature of Picture Rock. Belay from on top of chockstone between Picture and Phallus. Start up short right facing dihedral to a crux bulge pull. Good gear. Then up to a pin, followed by a buttonhead bolt, and one more pin after that. Rp's are nice to fill in the run-out spaces.
content.protection: Single rack to #2   1 bolt   Use rap anchors

content.description: Very intimidating and challenging this one is. Originally equipped with 7 pins and seriously sandbagged at 12a. The opening 15' is a desperate layback crux but is only protected by a couple pins (one was pulled out by hand) and some decent Rp's. Rest on the giant hollow flake, then pull face moves directly above. Follow crack up and right to arete, passing one bolt. Build anchor on top and needles style rap off.
content.protection: Single rack to BD #2    Rp's/Nuts   1 bolt   No anchor
content.location: Immediately off the road on NW aspect of formation. Just right of the 'T' route.

content.description: Great route to take a beginer up for a wonderful view.Start in the notch area on the North End of the spire.  Climb the obvious crack system up to the top.

Picture Rock is a not very often climbed spire near Totem Pole.  It is a fairly wide spire compared to others in the area.  The summit is a good spot to take pictures of neighboring areas, especially the Cathedral Spires.
